scene_description_enriched: The scene depicts the Coronation of the Virgin Mary, a central event in Christian iconography. The Virgin Mary, dressed in white and seated on a golden throne, is being crowned by God the Father, who is depicted above her with a radiant halo. She has her arms crossed over her chest in a gesture of humility and acceptance. Around her, several angels with golden wings and robes are present, some attending to her and others looking on. The Virgin is seated on a blue, circular platform inscribed with Latin text that reads "AVE VIRGO ASSUMPTA EST AD ETHERA" (Hail, Virgin, thou art assumed into heaven). The background is a vibrant blue sky, suggesting a celestial setting.
